Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: May 1, 2018 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Respondent was charged with having agents that sold its products in an unfair, deceptive, misleading and/or fraudulent manner. Respondent did not admit the charges, but agreed to remediate in settlement of the charges against the insurer.
Agency: New Jersey Department of Banking & Insurance

Company: Ameritas Life Insurance Corp. of New York
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: $10,000 fine for charging rates other than their filed and approved rates. RCW 48.19.010(2).
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: $50,000 fine with $20,000 suspended for selling combined vision and dental plans despite such plans being specifically disapproved by the Insurance Commissioner two (2) years earlier, the Company violated RCW 48.19.040(6); justifying the imposition of a fine under RCW 48.19.430. Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Pennsylvania Department of Banking and Securities

Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority ordered 12 firms to pay restitution totaling more than $4 million and fines totaling more than $2.6 million for failing to apply available sales charge discounts to customers' purchases of Unit Investment Trusts (UITs), and related supervisory failures.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.

Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined Ameritas Investment Corp., of Lincoln, NE, $100,000 and has suspended and fined one of its brokers for inducing customers to take on additional mortgage and/or home equity debt in order to purchase variable universal life insurance policies (VULs). Those policies were pitched to customers as mechanisms for funding college expenses and retirement.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
